greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Nonzero residues of Catalan sequence modulo 3; related to the Thue-Morse sequence (A001285).
comment: The runs of zeros in between the digit strings are given in A085296.
formula: If a leading '1' is added to the Catalan sequence modulo 3, the only nonzero digit strings are {1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2} and {2, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1}. Replacing these digit strings with their first digit, {1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2} -> '1' and {2, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1} -> '2', then omitting all zeros, results in the Thue-Morse sequence.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jun 24 2003
